units.title: CellPhoneDB analysis
units.text: We develop CellPhoneDB v.3.0 to measure intercellular communication taking into account spatial coordinates of cells and use this tool to define cell signaling in both lumenal and glandular microenvironments.
units.rationale: Describes the computational step for inferring cell‑cell interactions.

units.title: Generation of uterine cell map
units.text: We were able to generate a uterine map of 98,568 cells from 15 individuals by integrating our dataset with previous scRNA-seq data obtained from superficial endometrial biopsies22 (Fig. 1b, Extended Data Fig. 1b–f and Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Details the data integration process to create a comprehensive cell atlas.

units.title: smFISH validation
units.text: Single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) with RNAscope probes shows higher expression of the proliferative marker MKI67 in the superficial layer of the endometrium during the proliferative phase, validating Visium data (Extended Data Fig. 5a).
units.rationale: Provides an experimental validation of spatial transcriptomics findings.

units.title: Organoid generation and benchmarking
units.text: We generate three-dimensional endometrial organoids at single-cell resolution to characterize their hormonal responses in vitro and design a computational toolkit to compare the results with those observed in vivo to benchmark this model system.
units.rationale: Outlines the creation of organoid cultures and their comparative analysis.

units.title: Modulation of signaling pathways in organoids
units.text: We modulate WNT and NOTCH pathways in the organoid cultures, we develop lineage-specific endometrial epithelial cells and define the molecular events involved in their response to ovarian hormones.
units.rationale: Specifies experimental manipulation of key developmental pathways.

units.title: Definition of SOX9 epithelial subsets
units.text: We define three SOX9 subsets: (1) SOX9+LGR5+ cells, expressing KRT17 and WNT7A; (2) SOX9+LGR5− cells, expressing IHH; and (3) proliferative SOX9+ cells, including both LGR5+ and LGR5− cycling cells (that is, cells in G2M/S phase).
units.rationale: Classifies epithelial populations based on marker expression.

units.title: Spatial mapping of SOX9 subsets
units.text: We integrate scRNA-seq and Visium data (Fig. 2e and Extended Data Fig. 4c) and define specific spatial coordinates for these SOX9 subsets: (1) non‑cycling SOX9+LGR5+ cells are enriched in the surface epithelium; (2) non‑cycling SOX9+LGR5− cells are located in the basal glands; and (3) cycling SOX9+ cells map to glands in the regenerating superficial layer.
units.rationale: Links transcriptional subsets to their anatomical locations.

units.title: Cell2location integration
units.text: We develop a computational integration of coupled single‑cell transcriptomics and Visium data using our recently developed cell2location algorithm.
units.rationale: Describes the method used to map cell types onto spatial spots.

units.title: Cluster identification and annotation
units.text: We identify 14 clusters that were assigned cell identity based on their expression of known markers (Extended Data Fig. 1g).
units.rationale: Summarizes the clustering and annotation workflow.

units.title: Combined snRNA‑seq and spatial profiling
units.text: snRNA‑seq—alongside spatial transcriptomics methods (10x Genomics Visium slides and high‑resolution microscopy) (Fig. 1a and Extended Data Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Combines nuclear RNA sequencing with spatial imaging for full‑thickness profiling.
